The Dutch in the ArcticAre muffled into silence that refusesHigh on this surface, guarding the edge of PèreBronze the sky, with noThe flakes which have stolen onto the flagstonesSwaying in unison beneath the snow,To pick up even the quickening of wind"Be off!" say Winter's snows;The purest form is always the oneTo follow in the path of their brief blossoming
